channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 8 Israeli soldiers killed in Gaza in deadliest attack on Israeli forces in months
item.description: The attack, coming more than eight months into a grinding war that shows few signs of ending soon, was likely to fuel new calls by Israeli protesters for a cease-fire.
item.content:encoded:
The attack, coming more than eight months into a grinding war that shows few signs of ending soon, was likely to fuel new calls by Israeli protesters for a cease-fire.

(Image credit: Ohad Zwigenberg)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 'Inheriting' podcast explores how historic events shape AAPI families
item.description: A new podcast from LAist Studios and the NPR Network explores how events that played out decades ago shape AAPI families today.
item.content:encoded: A new podcast from LAist Studios and the NPR Network explores how events that played out decades ago shape AAPI families today.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Former federal judge deciphers Aileen Cannon's judicial choices in Trump case
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with retired judge Shira Scheindlin about what stands out to her about how the judge overseeing former President Trump's Florida classified documents case is proceeding.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with retired judge Shira Scheindlin about what stands out to her about how the judge overseeing former President Trump's Florida classified documents case is proceeding.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Back in the public eye, Princess Kate attends first royal event after cancer diagnosis
item.description: Catherine, Princess of Wales, has said she had a few more months left in her chemotherapy treatment and she is making "good progress."
item.content:encoded:
Catherine, Princess of Wales, has said she had a few more months left in her chemotherapy treatment and she is making "good progress."

(Image credit: Chris Jackson)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Sudan's local kitchens are stepping in to make up for the lack of international aid
item.description: International aid groups are struggling to provide relief across Sudan. Mohanad El Belal, co-founder of Khartoum Aid Kitchen, shares how some local kitchens are stepping in to feed hungry civilians.
item.content:encoded: International aid groups are struggling to provide relief across Sudan. Mohanad El Belal, co-founder of Khartoum Aid Kitchen, shares how some local kitchens are stepping in to feed hungry civilians.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Summer is the season of moving, and Americans do it more than any other country
item.description: Americans move more often than people from just about any other country. To kick off our summer series on moving, medical resident Art Hidalgo relates his move from New Orleans to Los Angeles.
item.content:encoded: Americans move more often than people from just about any other country. To kick off our summer series on moving, medical resident Art Hidalgo relates his move from New Orleans to Los Angeles.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Voters must dive into murky legal waters around 'contempt of Congress' fracas
item.description: It is hard to escape the impression that the more Congress holds people in contempt, the more people have contempt for Congress.
item.content:encoded:
It is hard to escape the impression that the more Congress holds people in contempt, the more people have contempt for Congress.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Ron Elving

item.title: Dear rat, did you ever know that you're my hero?
item.description: African giant pouched rats use their acute sense of smell to sniff out landmines and detect TB in sputum samples. Now, they are set to become search-and-rescue specialists too.
item.content:encoded:
African giant pouched rats use their acute sense of smell to sniff out landmines and detect TB in sputum samples. Now, they are set to become search-and-rescue specialists too.

(Image credit: Tommy Trenchard)
item.dc:creator: Tommy Trenchard

item.title: 16-year-old soccer player Lamine Yamal brings his homework to Euro 2024
item.description: 16 year-old Barcelona soccer player Lamine Yamal brought his homework with him to Euro 2024.
item.content:encoded: 16 year-old Barcelona soccer player Lamine Yamal brought his homework with him to Euro 2024.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: The week in AI: Apple announces AI features in new iPhone, Musk drops OpenAI lawsuit
item.description: A round up of this week's developments and drama in artificial intelligence: Apple announced a slew of AI features for its new iPhone and Elon Musk dropped his lawsuit against the maker of ChatGPT.
item.content:encoded: A round up of this week's developments and drama in artificial intelligence: Apple announced a slew of AI features for its new iPhone and Elon Musk dropped his lawsuit against the maker of ChatGPT.
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn
